turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Yabiji.
turn.2: Yabiji  Yabiji is the largest coral reef group in Japan, containing over 100 coral reefs and spanning about 17 by 6.5 km.
turn.4: Known for being above water level several times a year, most visibly around March 3, it was made a Natural Monument of Japan in 2013 as a place of Scenic Beauty.
turn.6: It is located about 6 km off the northern coast of Ikema Island.
turn.7: What species live in the area?
turn.8: The reef contains about 300 kinds of coral.
turn.10: The Ministry of the Environment has designated the reef as one of the 500 most important wetlands in Japan.
turn.12: In 2018, it was discovered that the living part of the reef had decreased by about 70% since 2008 from coral bleaching, due to rising water temperatures.
